input.query: What is ROS and what is it used for?

response.content:
ROS, or Robot Operating System, is a collection of tools and frameworks designed to simplify the automation of robotics projects. It provides a structured environment where developers can fill in automation code and define how different parts of their code communicate with one another. The underlying ROS framework manages the networking and connections between these components.

ROS is used for developing robotics applications by allowing users to leverage a large open-source community and a wealth of prewritten code, which helps in accelerating project development without starting from scratch. It organizes all the software and code in the form of packages, which may include ROS nodes, libraries, message and service definitions, and dependencies. Essentially, ROS facilitates the creation and management of complex robotic systems by enabling communication between various programs (nodes) through data exchange over topics.

Getting Started with Robot Operating System (ROS)”
1. What is ROS?
For someone completely new to ROS, the best way to think about it is a collection of tools and frameworks
which make automating robotics projects much easier. Every ROS project has a certain structure which you
have to follow. Your job would be to fill in the automation code along defining how the different parts of your
code are communicating with one another. Once this is done, the underlying ROS framework takes care of the
actual networking and connections.
ROS also has the advantage of having a large open source community with tons of packages. This means you
have a lot of prewritten code to help with your project and you don’t have to start from scratch.

Don’t worry if you are still confused, you will start to get a better understanding with some hands on experience.
 To get a better understanding of what ROS is and why it exists, checkout out these videos ( 1  , 2).

known as  topics. In simple terms nodes are programs that perform a particular task and send out/receive data
